intro: Dalechampia liesneri, commonly known as the white-flowered dalechampia, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which is characterized by its milky sap and often showy floral structures. The plant features alternate, ovate to lanceolate leaves with prominent veins, and its flowers are clustered in cyathia, typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. Dalechampia liesneri produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or wetland habitats.
